Lack enough support: The claim lacks support as there is no evidence provided to back up the statement that four Republican representatives voted to impeach President Donald Trump.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the four Republican representatives mentioned in the post have already voted to impeach Trump, which is not accurate as the House has not yet voted on articles of impeachment.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that no Republicans voted for the resolution to start an impeachment inquiry against Trump.
Understate: There is no understatement bias present in the claim.
Exaggerate: There is no exaggeration bias present in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by presenting information that is not accurate or supported by evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the four Republican representatives mentioned in the post have criticized Trump in the past but have not yet voted to impeach him.
